newsitem.title: UK: Metals race higher in LME evening, copper tight.
newsitem.headline: Metals race higher in LME evening, copper tight.

text.p: Base metal prices all moved higher during Wednesday evening LME inter-office trading, tracking a tightening copper market which broke back above $2,400, traders said.
Copper's cash/threes backwardation, which was around $135 at the 1600 gmt kerb close, moved out to $145/155, reflecting U.S. buying and borrowing of September.
Also, the sensitive July/August rate, which was showing $110 backwardation earlier, featured a lack of lenders, traders added.
Three months chased up through $2,400 from kerb closing levels of $2,390 to stand at $2,418/20 a tonne at 1800 gmt.
Now that the uncertainty surrounding July option declaration is over, the ever-present tightness looming around July's "third Wednesday" will keep the market underscored.
Inevitably, zinc was pulled up to another 6-3/4 year high, building on its strong performance in the afternoon rings and ignoring overheated technicals, they said.

Although zinc's contango was slightly wider on Wednesday from the extremely narrow levels of $2/3 seen on Tuesday, tightness in September with major longs facing a big short is encouraging speculative buying.
Zinc was indicated at $1,470/73, up $10 from the kerb, while aluminium rose to $1,618/20.
